title: Red or Green Flag?
description: Read the behavior. The group debates: Is it a Red Flag (Toxic), Green Flag (Good), or Beige Flag (Weird)?

cards.content: They still share a Netflix account with their ex.
They clap when the movie ends in the theater.
They are rude to waiters.
They have zero social media presence.
They refer to themselves as an 'Alpha'.
They ask for a bite of your food without asking first.
They text 'Good Morning' every single day.
They sleep with a mattress on the floor (no bed frame).
They own a snake.
They talk about their mom on the first date.
They have never seen Star Wars.
They tip 25% minimum, even for bad service.
They bring a guitar to a party uninvited.
They call their pets their 'children'.
They drink milk with dinner.
They follow more than 1,000 people on Instagram.
They don't like music.
They are friends with all of their exes.
They wear sunglasses indoors.
They order for you at the restaurant without asking.
They text back immediately, always.
They take 24 hours to reply to a text.
They have a picture of themselves as their phone wallpaper.
They don't drink alcohol.
They prefer cats over dogs.
They hate reading.
They have never traveled outside their country.
They want to share their location with you after 1 week.
They laugh at their own jokes.
They correct your grammar in texts.
They insist on splitting the bill 50/50 exactly.
They chew with their mouth open.
They have over 10,000 unread emails.
They use a 3-in-1 shampoo/conditioner/body wash.
They don't like chocolate.
They ask for your zodiac sign immediately.
They don't like watching sports.
They quote memes in real life conversation.
They want to move in together after 2 months.
They talk bad about all their exes.
They invite you to a wedding on the second date.
They don't eat crust on pizza.
They put pineapple on pizza.
They kiss with their eyes open.
They have a 'Live, Laugh, Love' sign in their house.
They drive a really loud car.
They refuse to dance at weddings.
They don't use turn signals.
They are always 15 minutes late.
They are always 15 minutes early.
They check their phone during dinner.
They never check their phone when with you.
They like their steak well-done.
They track their macros/calories religiously.
They have a joint bank account with their parents.
They say 'I love you' to their friends.
They don't own a TV.
They refuse to kill bugs and carry them outside instead.
They own more shoes than you.
They have a nickname for their car.
They watch movies with subtitles on.
They wear socks to bed.
They have a tattoo of a partner's name.
They are brutally honest at all times.
They hate surprises.
